bug.author: SinaChavoshi
bug.summary: Page rendering broken for notebook page
bug.description:
If i leave the cluster for a while ( usually 4-5 days) and try to connect to the notebook page the rendering of the notebook page comes up broken. see screen shot: <denchmark-link:https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Byyqe4XTEve>https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Byyqe4XTEve</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20114005/61737240-a175b680-ad3c-11e9-9b55-a41e8f264813.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.98. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

This seems like the same issue as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/issues/908>kubeflow/pipelines#908</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/2852>#2852</denchmark-link> . I don't think there's anything specific in the UI layer we can do to address it at this time but it does seem to be an error that occurs across all web surfaces in Kubeflow after the cluster remains idle for some period of time.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/SinaChavoshi>@SinaChavoshi</denchmark-link> Are you using Kubeflow 0.5 or 0.6? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/2852>#2852</denchmark-link> is the uber issue for upstream/disconnect errors. The current recommendation is to upgrade to 0.6 and see if the error still occurs.

this was on 0.5 I'm verifying if it reproduces on 0.6. In the mean time I'll close this issue as the root cause is same as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/2852>#2852</denchmark-link> , if it reproduces on 0.6 I will add to that thread.
